page.title: 20Breamore-A Brief Botany
page.content: densely covered,at different times of year,by wild daffodils,bluebells and foxgloves. But the floral glory of Breamore is the small remnant of uncultivated {chalk downland.}In July it is a colourful wild garden of knapweed, ladies bedstraw,marjoram,migonette, viper's bugloss,agrimony and many more. The delicate yellow blossoms of the cowslip once nodded in the breeze on many chalky pastures. In the Fifties, it was still picked for flavour as well as decorative value. Vast numbers were needed to make cowslip wine,which appeared at local shows. Now the downs are huge arable fields,and I found only three lonely cowslip plants on a five-mile walk through Breamore's downland.
